title: Teen dies after accidental shooting
content:
ANDERSON – A 17-year-old has died after being accidentally shot by his brother, police said.
Reynaldo Pizana, a Latino male, died of a gunshot wound to the chest on Tuesday, according to Marian Dunnichay, Madison County coroner. He died at Community Hospital Anderson after Pizana’s 17-year-old brother apparently accidentally shot him.
The incident was called in to 911 allegedly by the shooter at about 4:05 p.m.
When police arrived, Pizana was unresponsive, and officers performed CPR, said Maj. Joel Sandefur of Anderson Police Department.
The incident happened inside their home in the 1600 block of West Seventh Street. Details about what happened during the incident have not been released because the investigation is ongoing, Sandefur said.
Hunter Harrison, who lives with his parents near the shooting, said he was outside when he heard the shot ring out and he ran inside to tell his mother to call the police.
He said after police arrived, he saw a young man being carried out on a stretcher with a wound in his chest.
Sandefur said the investigation of the incident is ongoing, and no one has been charged at this time.
Dunnichay said an autopsy is scheduled Wednesday to determine the exact cause of death.
Reporter Christopher Stephens contributed to this report.
